alert.note: Alert for Northeast Mountains; Okanogan Valley; Spokane Area; Waterville Plateau; Wenatchee Area (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 25 at 3:46AM PDT until October 25 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FIRST SNOW EVENT FOR THE INLAND NORTHWEST TODAY... .Significant mountain snow accumulation above 3000 feet and measurable snow for lower elevations below 2500 feet. A robust and cold weather system will deliver mountain snow, lowland rain-snow, and colder overnight temperatures lingering through the remainder of the week. Mountain passes will be impacted by the heavy snowfall and lowland areas may see impacts to trees and sensitive vegetation from wet snow accumulation. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations a trace to 2 inches. A 30 to 50 percent chance of over 3 inches of snow for the Waterville Plateau. North to northeast winds gusting as high as 30 mph. * WHERE...Portions of North Idaho including the Coeur d`Alene metro area. Portions of Central, North Central, and Northeast Washington including the Okanogan Valley, Waterville Plateau, Wenatchee Valley, Colville area, West Plains, and Spokane. * WHEN...Until 5 PM PDT this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning commute. Locations that see heavy wet snow could experience tree damage if they have not yet lost their leaves.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Mountains; Okanogan Valley; Spokane Area; Waterville Plateau; Wenatchee Area
